CV

Education

  • 2006-2010 — DPhil Earth Sciences, University of Oxford. Supervisor: Prof. J.H. Woodhouse, FRS.
    Imaging the Earth: Methods and Algorithms for Global Seismic Tomography
  • 2002-2006 — BA (Hons.)/MSci Natural Sciences (Physics), University of Cambridge.

Academic employment

  • 2021-present — Assistant Professor, Department of Earth Sciences, Durham University.
  • 2016-2021 — Fellow, Research School of Earth Sciences, The Australian National University.
  • 2011-2016 — Postdoctoral Researcher, Department of Earth Sciences, Utrecht University.

Honours, awards and recognition

  • Honorary Senior Lecturer, Research School of Earth Sciences, The Australian National University (2021-present).
  • ARC DECRA Fellow (2018-2021).
  • Geophysical Journal International Outstanding Reviewer citation (2016, 2019).
  • Geophysical Journal International Student Author Award (2010).

Major roles and responsibilities

  • 2022-2023 — External Examiner, AI4ER CDT MRes programme, University of Cambridge.
  • 2021-present — Departmental IT Lead, Department of Earth Sciences, Durham University.
  • 2020-present — Editor, Geophysical Journal International.
  • 2020-present — Seismology Steering Committee member, CIG.

PhD student supervision

I have been formally named as (co-)supervisor for the following completed PhD theses:

  • Suzanne Atkins, Finding the patterns in mantle convection, Utrecht University, 2017.
  • Paul Käufl, Rapid probabilistic source inversion using pattern recognition, Utrecht University, 2016.
  • Ralph de Wit, Revisiting Earth’s radial seismic structure with a Bayesian neural network approach, Utrecht University, 2015.

In addition, I have served as a thesis committee member or informal advisor for numerous students.

Professional Society Memberships

  • Fellow, Royal Astronomical Society.
  • Member, Institute of Physics.
